data.title: Fargo's Mac Swanson named USHL Player of the Year
data.meta_description: Mac Swanson is the first player in Fargo Force history to receive the USHL Player of the Year award after racking up 77 points and leading the Force to a USHL-record 50 regular-season wins
data.text:
The USHL continued its individual awards from the 2023-24 season Friday afternoon with the USHL Player of the Year, presenting the award to Fargo’s Mac Swanson.

It’s the consecutive day Swanson has won an award, as the North Dakota commit was named the USHL Forward of the Year on Thursday.

Swanson is the first player in Force history to be named the USHL Player of the Year.

“Mac had a tremendous season for us,” Fargo head coach Brett Skinner told The Rink Live. “Obviously his talent and ability contribute to his success, but his drive and determination are what separate him from others. His off-ice approach with his daily habits no doubt enabled him to have the consistency he showcased all season.

“He continued to improve as the season went on and was able to play his best hockey towards the end of the season. His relentless work ethic, hockey sense and high-end talent were on full display every night and I’m extremely proud of him for what he was able to accomplish this season.”

Swanson finished his second USHL season with 26 goals and a team-leading 77 points, which ranked third in the USHL.

Swanson set a single-season franchise record with those 77 points and his 51 assists, and he has 132 points (38-94-132) over 112 career regular-season games. He was named to the USHL All-Rookie First Team last season as he racked up 55 points (12-43-55) over 57 games in his inaugural USHL campaign.

Swanson also finished this season with a +39 rating — which was tied with teammate Leo Gruba for the best mark in the USHL — and was assessed just six penalty minutes, as he helped Fargo win a USHL-record 50 games.

The Anchorage, Alaska, native finished the regular season on a tear, picking up points in 21 of his final 25 games, and came in at No. 152 among North American skaters in Central Scouting’s final draft rankings.

Swanson has followed it up with a tremendous postseason, as he currently leads the USHL with 12 playoff points. He scored the eventual game-winning goal Sunday night as Fargo earned a 4-0 win over Sioux City, earning its second consecutive trip to the Clark Cup Finals.

Fargo hosts Games 1 and 2 against Dubuque this weekend at Scheels Arena.

The full award schedule can be found below.

12 p.m. — All-USHL Teams

Thurs. May 9, 2024

10 a.m. — USHL Defenseman of the Year

12 p.m. — USHL Goaltender of the Year

2 p.m. — USHL Forward of the Year

Fri. May 10, 2024

10 a.m. — USHL Coach of the Year

12 p.m. — USHL GM of the Year

2 p.m. — USHL Player of the Year
